creator: Syretia
text:
Panda Wireless makes a few WiFi dongles that work out of the box on pretty much any Linux distro. They are a good solution if you have a built in WiFi chip that isn't supported/doesn't work well on Linux and are relatively cheap. ### [Panda Ultra 150Mbps N](https://www.amazon.com/Panda-Ultra-150Mbps-Wireless-Adapter/dp/B00762YNMG) - $12 USD ### [PAU06 300Mbps N with antenna](https://www.amazon.com/Panda-Wireless-PAU06-300Mbps-Adapter/dp/B00JDVRCI0/) - $14 USD ### [PAU0A 150/433Mbps dual band AC](https://www.amazon.com/Panda-Wireless-PAU0A-AC600-Adapter/dp/B07C9TYDR4) - $19 USD ### [PAU07 300Mbps Dual Band N](https://www.amazon.com/Panda-2-4GHz-300Mbps-Wireless-Adapter/dp/B00U2SIS0O) - $25 USD ### [PAU09 300Mbps Dual Band N with dual 5dBi antennas](https://www.amazon.com/Panda-Wireless-PAU09-Adapter-Antennas/dp/B01LY35HGO) - $40 USD
*This entry is outdated and needs updating.*
title: panda-wifi
caption: Cheap WiFi Dongles That Work On Linux
